title: 1940's Watterson Radio dialplate
content:
Hi everyone!  
I'm trying to identify what font(s) were used on this dial plate for a Watterson Radio that my dad is working on restoring, and having a hard time pinning down the exact font. It seemed similar to Futura with a few differences here and there. The radio was produced around the 1940's before the US entered World War II, so there weren't many of them made:  
 [http://www.radiomuseum.org/r/watterson\_78.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053946/http:/www.radiomuseum.org/r/watterson_78.html "http://www.radiomuseum.org/r/watterson\_78.html")

I have the dial plate scanned if that helps out with identifying what font(s) was used on it. You can click on the image to see its full size:  
 [![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053946im_/http:/i.imgur.com/44lCUv2.jpg)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053946/http:/i.imgur.com/44lCUv2.jpg)

In the event that it's actually made specifically for those radios, is there something similar that could be used? Thanks for your time!

Solved By: 

 [Ryuk](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053946/http:/typophile.com/user/22675 "View user profile.")
author: Damashki

comments.content:
Almost all letterings for gauge/dial are custom/hand-done/un-digitized.  
0123456789: ' [gaspipe](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053946/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/tag%3Agaspipe)' close to [Bolt](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053946/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-bolt) ITC; alternatives: [Pacifico](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053946/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/aerotype/pacifico), [Elephantmen](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053946/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/comicraft/elephantmen)/ [Great and Tall](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053946/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/comicraft/elephantmen-great-and-tall), [American Captain](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053946/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontry/american-captain), [Avengeance](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053946/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontry/avengeance), [Earth A.D.](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053946/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontry/earth-a-d), [ARB 66 Neon](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053946/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontry/arb-66-neon-block-jun-37-cas), [CFB1 Captain Narrow](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053946/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontry/cfb1-captain-narrow), [Drop Case](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053946/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/comicraft/drop-case), [Home Room](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053946/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/home-room), FF [Motel](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053946/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/ff-motel-gothic)/ [Matinee](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053946/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/ff-matinee-gothic)/ [GoldenGate](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053946/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/ff-goldengate-gothic) Gothic,  
AMERICAN/BROADCAST/POLICE/AMATEUR/FOREIGN: very ' [Futura](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053946/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/futura)'; you may like [Neutraface](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053946/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/neutraface), [Metallophile](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053946/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/metallophile-sp8) and [Uomo](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053946/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/latinotype/uomo)  
WATTERSON: even if that's not completely it, I like the approach of Dan Cassaro with his [Highway](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053946/http:/youngjerks.com/#/highway-typeface) typeface

Perhaps the closest to the numbers is Comicraft's Elephantmen

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053946im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ElephantmenNumbers_5755.gif)
 which was already suggested by Ryuk.  
If you can edit fonts a parallel line stroke to lighten the weight would make it even closer.  
Don
Thank you both for your help! This helps me out quite a bit. =)
